careers.title: Careers / Collaboration
careers.subtitle: Right now this is a one-person project built in Cairo. But I would love to make it grow faster — and I’m open to the right people joining early.

status.title: Current stage
status.p1: This product is still very early — built, maintained and supported 100% by one person (me). No investors, no team, no office, no HR department.
status.p2: That means things move fast when I’m focused, but also that I’m the bottleneck for almost everything: new features, bug fixes, support, documentation…
status.p3: If we want to make this project significantly bigger, faster and more reliable — I need help.

looking.title: Who I’d love to work with
looking.subtitle: I’m not looking for “employees” in the classic sense right now. I’m looking for co-builders who want to join early and help shape something meaningful.

role.frontendDesc: You love TypeScript, Tailwind, shadcn/ui, React Query, clean code and making complex UIs feel simple and fast.
role.fullstackDesc: Strong with Supabase/PostgreSQL, Node.js/Express/NestJS or Python/FastAPI, authentication flows, realtime (websockets), background jobs.
role.designerDesc: You can turn messy ideas into clean, intuitive interfaces. Bonus if you code (Figma → Tailwind is a superpower here).
role.otherDesc: DevOps, growth/marketing, documentation writer, community person, QA — if you’re excited about this space and want to contribute, let’s talk.

deal.title: What I can offer right now
deal.revshare: Revenue share / significant equity — if we grow this together, you get a real piece of it
deal.remote: 100% remote — work from anywhere (I’m in Cairo, timezone flexible)
deal.ownership: Real ownership — your ideas, code and decisions will shape the product
deal.fast: Very fast iteration — no meetings hell, no red tape, ship things quickly
deal.real: No salary right now — early stage means high risk + high potential upside

cta.title: Interested in joining early?
cta.subtitle: No formal application process. Just write me honestly — tell me who you are, what you’re good at, why this project excites you, and how you think you can help.
cta.ps: P.S. Even if you’re not ready to commit full-time — part-time, freelance, code reviews, design feedback, translations, documentation… all welcome.
